page.title: 10CHANGE IN BURNT HEATH
page.content: We interviewed a resident of{Burnt {Heath,}a street of 17 houses, to hear about the differences between living there now and 30 years ago.The houses had{no taps}or{mains water,}so water was fetched in buckets from a well. There were{no inside lavatories,}only earth closets at the bottom of the gardens. Thirty years ago the fields were smaller,there were no more hedges than there are now and crops were grown to feed the working{farm horses. { }At that time, living in the street was a thatcher,a postman,a porter,a nursery worker and a builder; now there is a gardener,a factory worker,a builder,a shop assistant,an electrician and a nurse. Life is more comfortable now !.
